question: what are different types of Cisco OS's
notes: NX-OS is the Cisco nexus data center IOS-XR runs on service provider routers IOS-XE runs on the ASR1000 of service provider routers

question: Command line interface for SECURELY connecting to the devices management IP address over the network
notes: SSH is a secure way to connect to the command line interface over the network

question: UNSECURE way to connect to a network devices command line interface
notes: Telnet is supported but not reccomended

question: What is the name of the server that enforces secure logins through this centralized server
notes: Enterprises will user (AAA) Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting server for secure login to network devices.

question: Name of popular client used to connect to network devices
notes: PuTTY is a client used to connect to network devices over serial, Telnet, and SSH

question: Network device management question, What is the name for the network that all traffic goes through from a network engineer point of view
notes: The production network is the network path that non network devices use, network management could also use this type of network engineers may also use a completely different network for managing Network Devices

question: Network device management question, What is the name for the network that is used just for managing network devices
notes: The reason for separating the networks allows for a path to to the network devices if the Production network were to be down.

question: Network management question: ___ management uses the Production network
notes: in band management uses the production network, the band represents all traffic

question: Network management question: ___ management uses the management network
notes: Out of band management uses the dedicated management network to manage the network devices

question: What connection method is used when setting up a new device without an IP address configured to it yet
notes: The console cable (typically DB9 to RJ45) is used for the initial configuration

question: New console cable connects USB to __-USB
notes: The newer console cables dont use the DB9 as computers and laptops no longer have the physical port to connect to it. The USB portion is more compatible with newer PCs and the Mini USB is also compatible with newer network devices (USB C is newer ever still)

question: When using Windows under Device Manager, what is the name of the port for the serial connection
notes: The COM port is used for the serical connections and used in PuTTY to connect the COM port # to the network device

question: Serial connection question, Speed
notes: The default speed of 9600 work for connecting using the serial connection in the network device console port

question: Serial connection question, how many data bits
notes: The default data bits are 8 for connecting using the serial connection in the network device console port

question: Serial connection question, how many stop bits
notes: The default stop bits are 1 for connecting using the serial connection in the network device console port

question: Serial connection question, What is the parity set to
notes: The default Parity is set to None as default for connecting using the serial connection in the network device console port

question: Serial connection question, What is the Flow control set to
notes: The default Flow control is set to None as default for connecting using the serial connection in the network device console port

question: Console connection Troubleshooting: when connecting to a network device if connectin to the __ ____ does not work use the console cable
notes: If connecting using the IP address does not work try the console cable as a trouble shooting step

question: Why would a network device not acquire an IP address
notes: If the network device fails to start up then there will be no IP address to connect to, using the console connection you can view the boot up process and the error messages when it fails to boot up.

question: what is the IOS command used to view all the commands that are available in the command hierarchy
notes: The question mark (?) is used to list all the available commands in the command lines current command hierarchy

question: What is the level 1 in the command line hierarchy. __ exec mode
notes: USER exec mode is the first level when logging into the Cisco IOS

question: What commands takes you from User Exec to Privilege exec mode
notes: The enable keyword goes up a level in the command line hierarchy

question: What is the level 2 in the command line hierarchy. __ exec mode
notes: Privilege exec mode is the level 2 command line hierarchy in Cisco IOS

question: What command takes you from Privilege mode into User mode
notes: the Disable command allows you to exit privilege exec mode

question: (mode question) Router>
notes: The device name followed by '>' signifies USER EXEC mode

question: (mode question) Router#
notes: The device name followed by '#' signifies PRIVILEGE EXEC mode

question: (command abbreviation)Router>en
notes: en is shortened version of the ENABLE command

question: the SHOW command is a part of this command hierarchy
notes: the show command is typically ran through the PRIVILEGE EXEC mode, it could be run in higher level command modes with the DO command 'DO SHOW'

question: from PRIVILIGE EXEC what command will switch mode into a configure mode
notes: The configure Terminal command, will enter the configuration mode from PRIVILIGE EXEC mode

question: What is a shortened command for CONFIGURE TERMINAL
notes: conf t command is the shortened version for CONFIGURE TERMINAL

question: (mode question)Router(config)#
notes: The device name followed by '(config)#' signifies global configuration mode
